wisps.metar_to_nc.enumerations module¶

Defines various enumerations used in metar conversion.

wisps.metar_to_nc.enumerations.default_func(ob)¶
wisps.metar_to_nc.enumerations.get_cloud_amount_enumeration(observation)¶

Where observation is the string that represents a code for the cloud amount

wisps.metar_to_nc.enumerations.get_enumeration_function(name)¶

Returns an enumeration function based if given ‘name’ enumeration. Otherwise, returns None.

wisps.metar_to_nc.enumerations.get_station_type(station_type_num)¶

Returns the string representation of the station type.

wisps.metar_to_nc.enumerations.get_station_type_enumeration(station_type_str)¶

Where station_type is the string that represents the station_type

wisps.metar_to_nc.enumerations.get_weather_type_enumeration(observation)¶

Where observation is the string that represents a code for the weather type

wisps.metar_to_nc.metarreader module¶

class wisps.metar_to_nc.metarreader.metarreader(def_path, val_path, filename=None)¶

Class for reading METAR formatted files. If the instance variable ‘filename’ is defined in the object and exists as a METAR formatted file, calling read will add stations to the station_list.

check_latlon()¶

Checks if the latitude on longitude of the stations are within bounds of station definitions.

obs_type = 'METAR'¶
parse_file(metar_reader)¶

Parses the file, creates station objects, for the observations.

parse_header(first_row)¶

Extracts header information from ‘first_row’

read(filename=None)¶

Starts reading self.filename.

read_station_definitions(file_path)¶

Reads all station definitions from file defined in control file. Returns a dictionary where the keys are the station call letters and has dictionary values such that {lat: xxx, lon:yyy}. Positive values indicate North or West, while negative values indicate South or East.

read_valid_stations(file_path)¶

Reads the valid METAR stations from file defined in control file. Returns them as a list.

wisps.metar_to_nc.metarreader.strip_array(arr)¶

Strips whitespace out of an array of strings. Will fail if not given a string list.

wisps.metar_to_nc.qc_general module¶

wisps.metar_to_nc.qc_general.check_bounds(in_arr, minimum, maximum)¶

checks values of in_arr to see if they are within the bounds of minimum and maximum. If outside of bounds, sets value to MISSING_VALUE

wisps.metar_to_nc.qc_general.check_consistency(in_array, type_array, tolerance=10)¶

Consistency check over 3 hours. If there are 2 consecutive hours of an increase/decrease of value by tolerance , check difference betwen the average of values 1 and 3 and value 2 If +- tolerance, report error, and change value to MISSING_VALUE.

wisps.metar_to_nc.qc_general.check_min_max(min_array, max_array)¶

Performs QC to check whether min array is greater than the max_array. If so, changes both values to MISSING_VALUE.

wisps.metar_to_nc.qc_main.flatten(l)¶

wisps.metar_to_nc.qc_temp module¶

wisps.metar_to_nc.qc_temp.calc_special_max(in_array, observed_max)¶

Find the maximum/minimum value(s) in an array. Return a tuple in which element 0 is the maximum/minimum value (if it exists), and element 1 is an array of indicies at which the the hourly max

was greater than the observed max by at least two, OR if the hourly max is only 1 over, then indicies at which this max is present, and

element 2 is the number of missing values

wisps.metar_to_nc.qc_temp.calc_special_min(in_array, observed_min)¶

Find the maximum/minimum value(s) in an array. Return a tuple in which element 0 is the maximum/minimum value (if it exists), and element 1 is an array of indicies at which the max was found, and element 2 is the number of missing values

wisps.metar_to_nc.qc_temp.check_6hour_max(hourly_temp_array, six_hour_max_array, date_array, station_type)¶

Performs QC on the 6 hour max temperature measurements.

wisps.metar_to_nc.qc_temp.check_6hour_min(hourly_temp_array, six_hour_min_array, date_array, station_type)¶

Performs QC on the 6hour time measurements.

wisps.metar_to_nc.qc_temp.check_dewpoint(dewpoint_arr, temperature_arr)¶
wisps.metar_to_nc.qc_temp.qc_temp(station_list)¶
wisps.metar_to_nc.qc_temp.qc_temp_st(station)¶

wisps.metar_to_nc.station module¶

class wisps.metar_to_nc.station.station(name)¶
add_empty_record(index, hour)¶

Takes in index for the hours object data field and the hour that should be inserted. This routine should be used when a station is not represented in a METAR file. This will give MISSING values too obersvations for the given hour.

add_record(observation_keys, values, hour, new=False)¶

Appends to the data for a given time period to the predictor dictionary for this station. ‘observation_keys’ is an array of all observations keys e.g. ‘TMP’, in METAR file. ‘values’ is a string list ‘hour’ is the hour of this observation ‘new’ is boolean indicating it’s the first record

check_duplicate_time(cur_hour)¶

Given cur_hour, returns if it is a duplicate to the last entered time.

fill_empty_records(start=None, end=None, delta=None)¶

start and end should both be datetime’s. delta should be a timedelta. This subroutine will identify any time gaps within a given time period an optional delta time in any of the station records and replace them with missing values

get_epoch_time()¶

Return hours array as seconds since the epoch

get_obs(obs_str)¶

Returns and array of the given observation string. e.g. ‘TMP’ would return the temperature array of the station.

get_region()¶

Returns this station’s region based on its lat/lon. Return values will be one of the following: ‘southeast’ ‘southwest’ ‘northeast’ ‘northwest’ ‘farnorth’

get_season(string_return=True)¶

Returns the season as a string, or if specified by ‘string_return=False’ a number, where, ‘spring’ : 0 ‘summer’ : 1 ‘fall’ : 2 ‘winter’ : 3 Assume that the duration of a station record will never be more than about a month .

is_AO2_or_MANU(i)¶

return true if station is a manual station (MANU) or if AO2 or AO2A.

is_auto(i)¶

Return true if station is an automatic station.

is_canadian()¶
is_closer_time(station_obs, predictors)¶

Returns a boolean based on whether the old station_obs is closer to 50 of the hour. MANU observations are selected over Automated observations. This function expects that the argument, station_obs, is from the same hourly record as the current last time.

is_russian()¶
parse_datetime_to_hour(time)¶

Assumed that time is a datetime object. hours are represented YYYYMMDDHH

parse_hour_to_datetime(time)¶

Assumed that time is in form YYYYMMDDHH, which is the format of the self.hours array.

wisps.metar_to_nc.util module¶

wisps.metar_to_nc.util.convert_to_numpy(station_list)¶

Takes a dictionary of stations, loops through each of their observation arrays and converts them to numpy

wisps.metar_to_nc.util.fix_rounding_errors(station_list)¶

Takes a dictionary of stations and rounds the float arrays

wisps.metar_to_nc.util.gen_filename(year, month)¶

Generates the netcdf filename for METAR observations

wisps.metar_to_nc.util.get_data_type(predictor, nc_struct)¶

This routine will get the data type for the given predictor. The predictor is expected to be a WISPS standard name for the obervation. Additionally, a dictionary entry ‘data_type’ needs to be defined in the netcdf configuration for this variable. The value for data_type should be a standard numpy data type. e.g. uint16, int8, _int, float, etc.

wisps.metar_to_nc.util.init_netcdf_output(filename)¶

Initializes the structure of the output netCDF file.

wisps.metar_to_nc.util.open_file(filename)¶

Opens a netcdf file with a given filename

wisps.metar_to_nc.util.parse_year_month(year_month)¶

Returns a two element string tuple of a combined yearmonth datestring.

wisps.metar_to_nc.util.read_obs(data_dir, year, month, def_path, val_path, day=None, stride=None)¶

Reads the observations from a given year and month (optionally day and stride). Uses a metarreader to get the data fromthe ASCII files.

wisps.metar_to_nc.util.real_nc_data_type(data_type)¶

Returns True if data_type is allowable in numpy

wisps.metar_to_nc.util.remove_time_buffer(station_list)¶
wisps.metar_to_nc.util.save_object(obj, filename)¶
wisps.metar_to_nc.util.scale_observation(observation, observation_array)¶

takes a METAR observation string and an associated array. If the scale factor is in the ‘scale’ dictionary, this function will scale the values of the array by that key value. This will NOT change the type of array.

wisps.metar_to_nc.util.write_call(stations, call_var)¶
wisps.metar_to_nc.util.write_dims(dimensions_dict, nc)¶

Writes nc dimensions that are packed into a structured format. The format is an array of dictionary objects where each dictionary has a ‘name’ and a ‘size’ key, and values that match the name of the dimension and the size of that dimension respectively

wisps.metar_to_nc.util.write_globals(structured_config, nc)¶

Writes nc globals that are packed into a structured format.

wisps.metar_to_nc.util.write_time(stations, time_var)¶

Write the variety of time variables with dimensions of time

wisps.metar_to_nc.util.write_type(stations, type_var)¶
wisps.metar_to_nc.util.write_variables(structured_nc_format, nc)¶

Writes metar variables to netcdf file handle
